author: jason
title: Rewarding Payroll Solutions Resume
description: Resumes are biased. A more trustless system helps hiring & leads to targeted discounts. Advertising in 2021 $649b & a bad hire costs ~$240k.

assessments.note: It is an interesting proposal however purely using total historical pay as signal of quality has issues. At a minimum more information such as number of jobs, whether fired before contract completion should be taken into account. Metadata about the type of job should also be recorded and taken into account. Also it suffers from a chicken and egg problem. Until many people have used it for a long time, it shows a very incomplete history of a worker. If it took off it would obviously drive usage of ADA in Africa.

The proposal proves to be very beneficial for the continent, because it intends to create a fairer and more reliable way of hiring professionals, through smart contracts. According to the text, these contracts will allow workers to seek job opportunities that fit their profile, while providing more secure information for companies. In this way, the economy will benefit greatly, and so will the Cardano project, while contracts will use blockchain.

The proposal addresses the Fund 5: Grow Africa, Grow Cardano challenge. It addresses How Cardano can reach more people in Africa and Asia by offering Payroll solution products that integrate Hiring with Paying Government Employee

The proposal aims to provide an unique (Cardano) payment address to an employee which can act as a resume. This idea has a basic adaptability problem in that every person who seeks a job wants to move to a higher-paying position. This proposal has substantial adaptation risks.

It is an interesting idea, however to be taken up by employers I believe it would need a more complex measure than just average and total pay. More complex quality metrics should be developed. It is also not clear that workers would accept payment in ADA given its recent volatility.

I found it very difficult to understand who is the author of this proposal. Is it John, Jason? Just as I did not understand who he is, I also did not know what his background would be. But if it is John, he is a person who has experience with AI, which is essential to carry out the project. It would be beneficial to make it clearer who the author is, what he does, and also if he intends to form a team, etc.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because the project plan is good. The team has experience and plan to hire more experienced engineers to build the hiring solution on top of Cardano Blockchain while offering the services to the government across Africa and Asia.
The proposal has claimed limited development experience and has accepted that he needs to identify developers interested in the project.

More detail should be provided on how it will be implemented and why employers would accept the provided metrics and employees payment in ADA. Could they not be paid in their local currency or a stable coin (or at least have that option) and the metadata recorded on the block chain?

Here steps taken in Assessment section could improve Auditability.
So clear step-by-step plan with metrics set would help Proposal auditability and
budget allocations for various steps or phases of the proposed project.

We are provided with a plan of how the project will work, according to the months. It is also detailed how the financing would be used. However, within this detail, which is really just a division of how much money would go to engineers and to transactions with governments, they could have more information, more explanations. For example, what would the USD 85000 be used for? Part of the salary of professionals, part of the construction of contracts? I was also confused about how these contracts would be hosted. If it's an app, a website...

The Roadmap is good but needs more details on the step-by-step action plan, including milestones and KPI'S. 
When do you plan to meet those governments? How many by when? When do you plan to release the product?
The proposal has not presented the full plan. There is a need for clarity on methodology and outline specifications.

solution: Qualify workers based on ledger documented wages. Evidence leads to a higher starting salary, reduction of bad hires or unlocking discounts.
experience: John is an AI architect with Intel Labs. He served as Chief Data Scientist for US SOCOM. He built his own coin. Two tours in Afghanistan.
